column1: //Graph LR - this is an optional special comment that requests TB (Top Bottom) or a LR (Left Right) flow diagram, the default is LR
// Extra formats can be selected using a | separated pair of terms - the format only needs to be defined the first time an entities is referenced

column3: Allow users to create modelling flow-diagrams from simple lists of triples
svg-pan-zoom is used to allow users to use their mouse to navigate around and zoom in and out of larger models

column1: // Comments can be added simply by starting a line with // or ##

column3: Subgraph are started by adding a special comment  before the relevant triples - //Subgraph GROUP TITLE
Subgraph are ended by adding a special comment  after the relevant triples - //end
Care needs to be taken to make sure which Subgraph nodes appear in, but it is possible to created nested sub-subgraphs simply by starting a new subgraph inside another one.

Any of the existing standard formats can automatically be applied to a subgraph by simply adding the name of the format after the //end line. For example this subgraph has been styled with the line //end base
Basic automatic formatting, but it is possible to force some further options using additional instructions after the third value in a given triple
Start with data formatted as JSON, which is then automatically converted to Triples, please check the triples and report any errors in the conversion

column1: // Blank node can be added as shown

column3: An automatic number each time the 'has type' property is used, so multiple _BN can be added to the list of triples and they will processed. All other properties will be allocated to the current _BN until a new 'has type' property is called.
Copying the triples and saving them as a text file.
Bookmarking or copying the URL under the Bookmark Link options, under the Links menu, after an update.
Following the link under the Get Image link, under the Links menu, and using the options provided.

New Blank Nodes, or any other entities can refer back to a previous Blank Node by adding a suffix to indicate how many Blank Nodes back one wants to refer to, i.e. the previous blank node would be referenced as '_BN-1' and the one before that would be '_BN-2' and so on.
